column4: Alright, I'm hoping I don't get flamed too hard here, but I'm going to throw this out there. I log in as root using Gnome, and I have since my Slackware days almost a decade ago now. Who can persuade me to change?
Ya, and so do all the XP users, and Mac's still believe there's no malware for their platform.  Who cares? ;)
So, what you're saying is that if everyone used root, more exploits would be developed and Linux as a whole would be less safe?
Uh, no?  If you read some of the trends, Linux is actually the number 1 exploited plat for services.  More Apache sites get pounded than IIS.
